dmmg package¶

Submodules¶

clustering module¶

class clustering.FileIndexer(filename)[source]¶
class clustering.InstructionsIndex[source]¶

Bases: dict

clustering.clusterize(listoclusters)[source]¶

Create clusters starting from a list of lists of single elements

clustering.initialize_clusters(file_dicts)[source]¶

Fill a feature list (InstructionsIndex) set with all the instructions passed as file_dicts. Remove a feature if it is not present in all files.

clustering.set_clustroid_mate(listoclusters)[source]¶

For each cluster, set the [-2] element as the closest to the clustroid

clustering.update_clustroid(cluster)[source]¶

Update the clustroid in a cluster using the minimum sum of squares

distances module¶

distances.edit_dist(s1, s2)[source]¶

Return the edit distance (insertions and deletions only) between two sequences s1 and s2.

distances.lcs(X, Y, m, n)[source]¶

Return the matrix (as a numpy 2D array) of the longest common subsequence between two sequences X and Y, where m and n are respectively |X| and |Y|.

distances.lcs_len(X, Y, m, n)[source]¶

Return the lenght of the longest common subsequence between two sequences X and Y, where m and n are respectively |X| and |Y|.

distances.lcs_print(X, Y, i, j, allign=True)[source]¶

Print the longest common subsequence between two sequences X and Y, where m and n are respectively |X| and |Y|. If allign is set to True (default) the print function will print also the gaps as ‘~’. Example: ‘abaco’ and ‘abbacchio’ will generate ‘a~ba~c~~o’.

distances.lcs_vector(X, Y, i, j)[source]¶

Return a list of pairs, each pair contains the starting element and the length for each continuos subsequence found. Example: ‘abbaino’ and ‘abbacchio’ will generate the allignment ‘abba~~~i~o’, lcs_vector will return [[‘o’, 1], [‘i’, 1], [‘a’, 4]]

dmmgclient module¶

dmmgclient.client_manager(ip, port, AUTH)[source]¶

Connects and return a ClientManager object to the ServerManager object listening on ‘port’ at ‘ip’. Both managers must share the same ‘AUTH’ (authentication key).

dmmgclient.compute_clusters(job)[source]¶

Return a tuple containing: (keyword, clusters) calling clustering.clusterize()

dmmgclient.compute_similarity(job)[source]¶

Return a tuple containing: (query, filename, similarity, semantic similarity, word order similarity) calling dmmgmain.similarity().

dmmgclient.dmmg_worker(job_q, result_q, jobs_e)[source]¶

While jobs_e is true pop a job from the shared job queue, resolve the task given and push the result on the shared result queue.

dmmgclient.start()[source]¶

Start the client with the configuration specified in settings.py.

dmmgclient.worker_manager(s_job_q, s_result_q, s_jobs_e, nprocs)[source]¶

Spawns ‘nprocs’ processes join them when they are done.

dmmgmain module¶

class dmmgmain.Storage(similarity)[source]¶
store(tup)[source]¶

Stores tuples whose similarity is greater or equal a certain treshold set in Storage.similarity.

dmmgmain.create_corpus(tagged)[source]¶

Take a list of tagged words and return a corpus as a list of tagged words with universal tagging and filtering all non-word entries

dmmgmain.filepath_gen(path)[source]¶

Yield all the filepaths contained in ‘path’ excluding hidden files.

dmmgmain.import_file(filepath)[source]¶

Take a filepath and return a list of tagged words

dmmgmain.nltk_updater()[source]¶

Install or updates needed nltk internal packages.

dmmgmain.print_stats(order_vector_1, order_vector_2, wos_measure, semantic_vector_1, semantic_vector_2, sem_measure, overall_similarity, time)[source]¶

Print similarity statistics.

dmmgmain.retrieve_model_file(test_filepath)[source]¶

Return the filepath of the file containing the model of the corresponding description contained in ‘test_filepath’.

dmmgmain.similarity(delta, file1, file2)[source]¶

Return the overall similarity, semantic similarity and word order similarity between ‘file1’ and ‘file2’ with the given ‘delta’.

[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9_]*

mzparse module¶

class mzparse.Node(typ, leafs, children, prod)[source]¶
create_tree_vector()[source]¶

Return a vector containing nodes in a dfs order

dump_subtree_terminals(lev)[source]¶

Return a string containing the terminals producted by the grammar that has generated this tree. The lev parameter specify when to stop

dump_tree()[source]¶
dump_tree_terminals()[source]¶

Return a string containing the terminals producted by the grammar that has generated this tree.

mzparse.compute_snippet_elements(s1, s2)[source]¶

Returns the snippets generated from ‘s1’ and ‘s2’.

parsetab module¶

semantic module¶

semantic.best_sim(element, corpus)[source]¶

Return the best similarity match given an element and a word corpus.

semantic.generate(corpus, joint_wordset, fdist)[source]¶

Return the semantic vector given a corpus, the joint wordset and the the word distribution statistics ‘fdist’.

semantic.sem_similarity(vector1, vector2)[source]¶

Return the semantic similarity between two semantic vectors.

word module¶

class word.Word(word, part)[source]¶
information(fdist)[source]¶

Return the Information for this word given a probability distribution (FreqDist)

similarity(other)[source]¶

Return Wu & Palmer Similarity between two words. Return 0 if words’ parts are not equals

wordorder.create_jointset(corpus_a, corpus_b)[source]¶

Create the Joint Word Set given two corpus (texts)

wordorder.create_ordervec(corpus, joint_word_set)[source]¶

Given a corpus (text) and a joint word set it creates a WOV

Calculate the Word Order Similarity between two order vectors
